name: ternary
description: the simplest way to conditionally execute code.
definition:
(macro ternary (cond if-true if-false)
       ["(" (transpile cond) ") ? "
            (transpile if-true) " : "
            (transpile if-false)])

examples.javascript: (50 < 100) ? "fifty is less than 100" : "fifty is more than 100"
examples.sibilant:
(ternary (< 50 100)
         "fifty is less than 100"
         "fifty is more than 100")

name: alias-macro
description:
stores a duplicate copy of `current-macro-name` as
`new-macro-name` in current namespace.  No output.
definition:
(macro alias-macro (current-macro-name new-macro-name)
       (var current-macro-name (output-formatter (transpile current-macro-name))
            new-macro-name (output-formatter (transpile new-macro-name)))
       (set sibilant.macros.namespace
            new-macro-name (get sibilant.macros.namespace current-macro-name))
       null)

name: send
description: calls the `method` on `object` as a function with `args` as the arguments
definition:
(macro send (object method ...args)
       [(transpile object) "." (transpile method)
               "(" (interleave ", " (map args transpile)) ")"])

name: apply
description: calls the function `fn` with arguments passed as an array in `arglist`

name: cons
description:
builds an array with `first` as the zeroth index and the
elements provided by array `rest` as the subsequent elements, as
siblings with `first`.

name: append
description: adds `additional` elements onto the right-side (tail) of `list`. deprecated

name: length
description: fetches length attribute from `arr`

name: scoped
description:
executes the `body` inside of a self-executing function. The
last statement/expression of the body is returned.

name: first
description: fetches the first element from `arr`

name: second
description: fetches the second element from `arr`

name: third
description: fetches the third element from `arr`

name: fourth
description: fetches the fourth element from `arr`

name: fifth
description: fetches the fifth element from `arr`

name: sixth
description: fetches the sixth element from `arr`

name: seventh
description: fetches the seventh element from `arr`

name: eighth
description: fetches the eighth element from `arr`

name: ninth
description: fetches the ninth element from `arr`

name: rest
description: fetches all but the first item of `arr`

name: last
description: fetches just the last element of `arr` by slicing.

adds `args` using the javascript `+` operator. Since javascript
overloads this for string concatenation, this macro can be used for
this as well.
subtracts each subsequent element of `args`
multiplies elements of `args`
divides each subsequent element of `args`

name: or
description: short circuiting operator returns the first element of `args` that evaluates to be truthy

examples.javascript: (1 === 2 || typeof [] === "string" || "one is not two and an array is not a string")
examples.sibilant: (or (= 1 2) (string? []) "one is not two and an array is not a string")

name: and
description:
returns the last element if all elements of `args` are truthy, or the
first non-truthy element if it exists

name: mod
description: modulus operator
compares `args` from left to right, returning true if each element is greater than than the next
definition:
(macro > (...args)
               (var js-comparator'"' >'"')
               `(and ...@(map (args.slice 0 -1)
                              (#(item index)
                                [ item " " js-comparator " "
                                  (get args (+ 1 index)) ]))))

description: compares `args` from left to right, returning true if each element is less than than the next
definition:
(macro < (...args)
               (var js-comparator'"' <'"')
               `(and ...@(map (args.slice 0 -1)
                              (#(item index)
                                [ item " " js-comparator " "
                                  (get args (+ 1 index)) ]))))

description: compares `args` from left to right, returning true if each element is less than or equal than the next
definition:
(macro <= (...args)
               (var js-comparator'"' <='"')
               `(and ...@(map (args.slice 0 -1)
                              (#(item index)
                                [ item " " js-comparator " "
                                  (get args (+ 1 index)) ]))))

description: compares `args` from left to right, returning true if each element is greater than or equal than the next
definition:
(macro >= (...args)
               (var js-comparator'"' >='"')
               `(and ...@(map (args.slice 0 -1)
                              (#(item index)
                                [ item " " js-comparator " "
                                  (get args (+ 1 index)) ]))))

description: compares `args` from left to right, returning true if each element is not equal (using threequals) than the next
definition:
(macro != (...args)
               (var js-comparator "!==")
               `(and ...@(map (args.slice 0 -1)
                              (#(item index)
                                [ item " " js-comparator " "
                                  (get args (+ 1 index)) ]))))

description: compares `args` from left to right, returning true if each element is equal (using threequals) than the next
definition:
(macro = (...args)
               (var js-comparator "===")
               `(and ...@(map (args.slice 0 -1)
                              (#(item index)
                                [ item " " js-comparator " "
                                  (get args (+ 1 index)) ]))))

name: incr-by
description: increments `item` by `increment`

name: incr
description: increments item by 1

name: decr
description: decrements item by 1

name: new
description:
uses the javascript new keyword to construct an object using
      `constructor`, with `args` passed as arguments to the constructor.

name: regex
description: builds a regex using `pattern` and `flags` as arguments to the RegExp constructor

name: zero?
description: predicate to test for equality with zero

name: empty?
description: returns true if the array `arr` has a length of zero

name: odd?
description: returns true if `number` is not divisible by 2

name: even?
description: returns true if `number` is divisible by 2 with no remainder

name: typeof
description:
exposes the javascript typeof operator. most often, predicates
such as `string?`, `function?`, `number?`, etc are preferred.

name: string?
description: returns true if all of the `things` are javascript strings

name: function?
description: returns true if all of the `things` are functions

name: undefined?
description:
returns true if all of the `things` are undefined, as tested
with `typeof`, not equality with literal undefined. This is the
inverse of `defined?`

name: defined?
description:
returns true if none of the `things` are undefined, as tested
with `typeof`. This is the inverse of `defined?`

name: number?
description:
returns true if all of the `things` are numbers, as tested
with `typeof`

name: pipe
description:
inserts the result of each subsequent call in `calls` as the
second argument to the next macro. This is very much akin to clojure's thread-first arrow or elixir's pipe operator
definition:
(macro pipe (...calls)
       (inject undefined calls
               (#(value item)
                 (if (undefined? value) item
                     (scoped
                      (var cloned (if (node? item 'literal 'dots)
                                      (get `(@item) 'source)
                                      (clone item)))
                     
                      (merge-into cloned
                                  { contents [ (first cloned.contents)
                                               value
                                               ...(rest cloned.contents) ] }))))))

examples.javascript: ("a b c d".toUpperCase().replace("A", "X").split(" ")[0] + " marks the spot")
examples.sibilant:
(pipe "a b c d"
                     .to-upper-case
                     (.replace "A" "X")
                     (.split " ")
                     first
                     (concat " marks the spot"))

name: comment
description:
inserts `contents` transpiled to javascript as a comment in the
output file, removing it from execution.
definition:
(macro comment (...contents)
       (map contents (#(content)
                       ["// "(recurse-map (transpile content)
                                    (#(item)
                                      (ternary item
                                               (pipe item transpile output-formatter
                                                     (.replace (regex "
" 'g) "
// "))
                                               null)))])))

name: array?
description:
returns true if `thing` is an array in javascript. aliased as
`list?`.
definition:
(macro array? (thing)
       (var transpiled (transpile thing))
       ["((" transpiled ") && typeof (" transpiled ") === \"object\" && ("
               transpiled ").constructor.name === \"Array\")"])

name: hash?
description:
returns true if `thing` is an object that is not an array in javascript. aliased as
`object?`.

name: when
description:
evaluates statements in `body` if `condition` is true. `body`
      is `scoped` in a self-evaluating function to support having a
      return value from the if statement.

name: not
description: boolean negation, as determined by javascript truthiness

name: unless
description:
evaluates statements in `body` if `condition` is falsy. `body`
      is `scoped` in a self-evaluating function to support having a
      return value from the if statement.

name: log-pretty
description:
outputs debug information about `arg`.  If `label` is
omitted (only one argument is provided), the name of the variable or
expression of that first expression will be logged. Aliased as `pretty-log`
definition:
(macro log-pretty (label arg)
       (var node this)
       (when (undefined? arg)
             (assign arg label
                     label ["\"" (prettify label false) "\""]))
       `(console.log (concat @["\"" node.file ":" node.line "\""] " " @label " = " (prettify @arg))))

name: each
description:
iterates over `array`, evaluating `body` once for each value in
`array`.  If `item` is a literal name, that will be the variable into
which the `array` element is yielded (current value).  If `item` is an expression, it
can contain the current value, the index, and the `array`.
definition:
(macro each (item array ...body)
       '(.for-each @array
                   (lambda @{ node this
                              args (if (node? item 'expression) item [item]) }
                           ...@body)))

examples.sibilant:
(each (letter index) `[ a b c d ]
                       (set letters letter index)
                       (pipe letter (.to-upper-case) (console.log)))

name: throw
description: throws a new javascript error with arguments as the string

examples.javascript: throw (new Error("could not find matching socks"))

name: as-boolean
description: double-negates `expr`, converting it to a boolean

name: while
description:
evaluates the `body` as long as `condition` is truthy,
returning the value of the last expression in `block` when `condition`
ceases to be truthy. See also `until`

name: until
description:
evaluates the `body` as long as `condition` is falsy,
returning the value of the last expression in `block` when `condition`
ceases to be falsy. See also `while`

name: match?
description:
returns true if the `string` matches `regexp`.  Deprecated in
      preference to `.match` (`send` dot-invocation).

name: match-regex?
description: similar to `match?` but builds a regex out of the `pattern` and `flags`.

name: replace
description: replaces the first occurance of `pattern` (as a regex) with `replacement`

name: replace-all
description: replaces all occurrances of `pattern` (as a regex) with `replacement`

name: thunk
description:
most often called as its alias, `#>`, thunk creates a function
with no named arguments. To refer to arguments anonymously, use #n,
such as #0 for the first argument.
definition:
(macro thunk (...body)
       (var node this
            lambda-options { node node args [] })

       (when (not (node? (first body)))
             (merge-into lambda-options (first body))
             (assign body (rest body)))

       '(lambda @lambda-options
       ...@(map-node body
                 (#(node)
                   (if (node? node 'arg-placeholder)
                       '(argument @(replace node.token "^#" ""))
                       node)))))

name: pipe-thunk
description: most often called as its alias, `#->`, pipe-thunk applies a pipe chain to the argument of a function and returns the result

examples.sibilant: (.map `[ a b c ] (#-> (.to-upper-case) (concat " is a letter")))

name: keys
description: returns the property names of `obj`.

name: delete
description:
uses the javascript delete keyword on any number of `objects`.
      Use in conjunction with `get` or dotted literal notation (a.b).

name: delete-macro
description: deletes each macro name in `macro-names` from the current namespace. Use carefully
definition:
(macro delete-macro (...macro-names)
       (each macro-name macro-names
             (delete (get sibilant.macros.namespace (output-formatter (transpile macro-name)))))
       null)

name: rename-macro
description: moves macro from `current-macro-name` to `new-macro-name`. Use carefully
definition:
(macro rename-macro (current-macro-name new-macro-name)
       (^alias-macro current-macro-name new-macro-name)
       (^delete-macro current-macro-name)
       null)

name: arguments
description: transforms function arguments into an array, using the Array prototype's slice

name: argument
description: `get`s the argument at `index` in the current function context. Inside of a `thunk` (`#>`), this can be abbreviated with `#n`, where `n` is the argument index.

name: each-key
description: iterates over each attribute in `obj`
definition:
(macro each-key (as obj ...body)
       `(pipe @obj (keys)
              (.for-each (lambda @{ args: (if (node? as 'expression) as [as])
                                    node: this }
                                 ...@body))))

name: switch
description: uses the javascript switch construction to test equality.  documentation todo: needs better description
definition:
(macro switch (obj ...cases)
       ["(function() {"
         (indent ["switch(" (transpile obj) ") {"
                   (map cases (#(case-def)
                                (var case-name-node (first case-def.contents)
                                     case-labels (if (node? case-name-node 'expression 'bracket)
                                                     case-name-node.contents
                                                     [case-name-node])
                                     case-string (interleave "
"
                                                             (map case-labels (#(c)
                                                                                (if (= 'default c.token)
                                                                                    "default:"
                                                                                    ["case " (transpile c) ":"])))))
                                ["
" case-string (indent '(do ...@(rest case-def.contents)))]))
                   "}"])
         "}).call(this)"])

examples.sibilant:
(switch char
                         ('a "it was an a")
                         ('b (console.log "found a b!")
                             "it was a b")
                         ([1 2 3 4 5] "it was an integer from one to five")
                         (default "not sure"))

name: if
description:
tests any number of `alternating-conditions-and-branches`.  If
      an odd number of branches are supplied, the final branch is a
      default else clause.  To evaluate more than one expression as a
      branch, use the `do` macro, as shown in the examples:
definition:
(macro if (...alternating-conditions-and-branches)
       ["(function() {"
        (indent
         (interleave " else "
               (bulk-map alternating-conditions-and-branches
                         (#(cond val)
                           (if (!= (typeof val) 'undefined)
                                 ["if (" (transpile cond) ") {"
                                   (indent '(do @val))
                                   "}"]
                                 ["{" (indent '(do @cond)) "}"])))))
        "}).call(this)"])

name: chain
description:
similar to `pipe`, this macro allows function calls to be applied
in sequence, as is common in fluent interfaces. deprecated in preference to `pipe`
definition:
(macro chain (object ...calls)
       (if (= 0 calls.length) (transpile object)
           (= 1 calls.length) '(send @object ...@(get (first calls) 'contents))
           (do
            (var lines (map calls (#(call index)
                                    ["." (transpile (first call.contents))
                                         "(" (interleave ", " (map (rest call.contents) transpile)) ")"])))

            [ (transpile object)
              (first lines)
              "
  "
              (recurse-indent
               (interleave "
" (rest lines)))])))

name: instance-of?
description: uses the javascript `instanceof` operator to check if `item` is of `type`.

name: includes?
description: returns true if `haystack` includes `needle`.  `haystack` can be a string or array/list.

name: excludes?
description:
returns true if `haystack` does NOT include `needle`.
`haystack` can be a string or array/list

name: exists?
description: similar to the javascript truthiness predicate `as-boolean`, returns true unless the `thing` is undefined or null

name: join
description:
combines elements of array `arr` into a string, inserting
`glue` string between each element.  if `glue` is omitted (only one
argument provided), the elements of `arr` are joined with an empty
string
definition:
(macro join (arr glue)
       (if (and (defined? glue) (undefined? arr))
           (assign arr glue glue undefined))
       `(.join @arr @(or glue "\"\"")))

name: var
description:
registers variables in `pairs` inside of the current scope using the javascript var keyword.
destructuring from arrays and objects is also supported, as shown in the examples

name: assign
description:
assigns alternating keys and values in `args`.  This works much
like `var`, but without the var keyword.  It is important to
understand variable scope in javascript in order to use this macro safely.
This macro supports destructuring, as shown in examples

examples.sibilant:
(assign { a b } c
        [ x y ] a)

name: default
description:
sets default values for variables in current scope. `pairs` are
alternating variable names and default values

examples.javascript:
a = (typeof a !== "undefined") ? a : 10;
b = (typeof b !== "undefined") ? b : 20;

name: has-key?
description: checks if `object` has property `key`.  returns true or false.

name: get
description:
retreives object properties, potentially deeply. If more than one `keys` are provided,
`get` fetches deeply into nested objects or arrays.
When javascript dot notation can be used (`a.b = 3`), it is.
Otherwise, bracket notation is used.
definition:
(macro get (obj ...keys)
       [(transpile obj)
         (map keys (#(key)
                     (var transpiled (transpile key)
                          output (output-formatter transpiled))

                     (if (match-regex? output "^\"[a-zA-Z0-9]+\"$")
                         ["." (replace-all output "\"" "") ]
                         ["[" transpiled "]"])))])

name: set
description:
assigns object properties to `arr` in pairs, alternating between keys and values.
When javascript dot notation can be used (`a.b = 3`), it is.  Otherwise, bracket notation is used

examples.sibilant: (set object dynamic-attribute-name "key name determined at runtime")

name: lower-case?
description: checks if a string is identical to the lower-cased version of itself

name: upper-case?
description: checks if a string is identical to the upper-cased version of itself

name: source-mapping-url
description: inserts a pragma for source-mapping-url
definition:
(macro source-mapping-url (url)
       [ "//# sourceMappingURL=" (|> url transpile output-formatter eval) "
" ])

name: sort-by
description: sorts `array-of-objects` by `attribute` using locale-compare
